meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back with my review of Humanity, that quirky little puzzle game that's got everyone talking. But before we dive into the details, let me just say that it's an absolute blast to play. Like, seriously, you'll be hooked from the get-go.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What's all the fuss about?" Well, for starters, Humanity is like a symphony of puzzle-solving goodness. It's all about guiding these tiny, adorable creatures as they navigate through levels, solving problems and collecting goodies along the way. Sounds easy peasy, right? Wrong! These little critters have minds of their own, and it takes some serious strategy to get them where you want.

And don't even get me started on the levels. They're like a never-ending box of Legos - fun, colorful, and just begging to be messed with. I mean, who doesn't love creating an army of lemmings to take down a pesky laser beam? It's like Enhance knew exactly what they were doing when they designed this game.

Now, let's see what the critics have to say. IGN gives it a 90, saying that Humanity is "a beautiful, modern reimagining" - okay, I get it, you're trying to sound smart. GameSpot thinks it's a "charming, engaging, and inviting puzzle adventure," which I agree with wholeheartedly. And don't even get me started on Game Informer, who says that Humanity strikes a "delicate balance between challenging [players] at every turn...". Yeah, yeah, we get it, you like puzzles.

But enough about what the pros have to say. Let's talk about the cons - or rather, the lack thereof. I mean, sure, there might be some tiny little nitpicks here and there, but trust me when I say that this game is basically perfect. The visuals are adorable, the music is catchy, and the gameplay? Oh boy, the gameplay.

So, what's the takeaway? If you haven't played Humanity yet, what are you even doing with your life? Get on it, folks! It's a game that will keep you coming back for more - just like me, when I'm trying to solve the next level. Happy gaming, everyone!
